title: Inside McLaren’s star-studded driver academy with IndyCar sensation and three champions | F1 | Sport | Express.co.uk
text:
Pato O'Ward is one of the biggest talents in the McLaren Driver Development Programme (Image: Getty) In Lando Norris and Oscar Piastri , McLaren have two of the hottest talents in F1 in their driver line-up and while their consistently impressive performances may be attracting the attention of the sport’s top teams, Zak Brown and Andrea Stella have a wealth of talent in waiting should they need to delve into their driver academy to find their successors.

Verstappen outlines plans for after F1 retirement as Red Bull star eyes new role The McLaren Driver Development Programme has a storied history of promoting some of the sport’s biggest talents into F1 with the most notable graduates being seven-time world champion Lewis Hamilton and Norris, who has delivered 13 podiums during his five-year stint with the team so far.
Kevin Magnussen also graduated into F1 with McLaren, spending two seasons with the Woking-based team before moving on to Renault in 2016, and eventually Haas, where he remains to this date. Nyck de Vries, Alex Albon and Stoffel Vandoorne were also once part of the team’s young driver programme.
Of the five drivers currently involved in the programme, the most eye-catching name is Pato O’Ward. The 24-year-old is a four-time IndyCar race winner and has recorded 20 podium finishes during his first five seasons in the series.
The Mexican driver hasn’t finished lower than seventh in the standings since the start of the 2020 campaign and has often been the fastest and most consistent of the Arrow McLaren driver crop during his time with the team.

F1 fans have already been given an introduction to what O’Ward is capable of. He made FP1 appearances in Abu Dhabi during both the 2022 and 2023 seasons and will be McLaren’s official test and reserve driver next year, replacing two-time IndyCar champion Alex Palou in the role.
The new-look junior team contains three reigning champions too. One of those is Gabriel Bortoleto, who stormed to the Formula 3 title in 2023 thanks to two victories and a further four podiums. The 19-year-old is making the step up to Formula 2 next year with the Invicta Virtuosi team.
16-year-old Ugo Ugochukwu also became a champion in 2023, winning one-third of the nine races in the Euro 4 Championship as he pipped Tuukka Taponen and Red Bull junior Arvid Lindblad to the title. The American teenager will be following in the footsteps of Mercedes starlet Kimi Antonelli, driving in FRECA for PREMA Racing next year.

Bianca Bustamente is one of the latest additions to the McLaren ranks (Image: Getty) As well as the two junior champions, McLaren have Japanese star Ryo Hirakawa on their books. The 29-year-old is an established name in the motorsport community and is a reigning WEC champion after triumphing in the Hyperclass for Toyota in 2023.
After the conclusion of the inaugural F1 Academy season, McLaren announced that they had signed Filipina racer Bianca Bustamente to their ranks. She will be the team’s representative in the series for 2024 as the 18-year-old looks to add to her two victories and four podium finishes in her rookie campaign.
